title: Quiz 2: Primary Health Care (PHC)
description: Test your knowledge on the essential elements, principles, and objectives of Primary Health Care.

questions.question: In the acronym 'ELEMENTS' for PHC components, the first 'E' stands for ___BLANK___ concerning prevailing health problems.
questions.explanation: E - Education concerning prevailing health problems and methods of preventing them.

questions.question: Select the correct components represented by the acronym 'ELEMENTS' in Primary Health Care. (Select 4)
questions.explanation: PHC focuses on essential services: Education, Local diseases, Expanded immunization, MCH, Essential drugs, Nutrition, Treatment, Safe water.
questions.hint: PHC is about basic, essential care, not specialized surgery.

questions.question: Which principle of PHC emphasizes that health interventions must involve sectors like agriculture, housing, and education, not just medicine?
questions.explanation: The Multi-sectional Approach recognizes that health is influenced by many factors beyond medical care.
questions.hint: Think about involving 'multiple sections' or departments.

questions.question: Primary Health Care aims to provide services only to those who can afford to pay for them to ensure sustainability.
questions.explanation: False. A core principle of PHC is 'Equitable Distribution' - services must be accessible to all regardless of ability to pay.
questions.hint: Think about the goal 'Health for All'.

questions.question: Match the PHC concept with its definition:

pairs.right: Services provided equally to all regardless of status
Involving locals in planning and implementation
Methods that are scientifically sound and socially acceptable
Developing community capability to manage own health

questions.explanation: These are the key operational principles that make PHC work effectively in diverse settings.

questions.question: What is the term for essential health care made universally accessible to individuals and acceptable to them, through full participation and at a cost the community can afford?
questions.explanation: This is the standard WHO definition of Primary Health Care (PHC).
questions.hint: It is the main topic of this quiz.

questions.question: Review the list of 'Extended Elements in the 21st Century' below. Which item is NOT traditionally part of the original 8 PHC elements but is included in the extended list?

richContent.content:
• Reproductive health needs
  • Prevention of non-communicable diseases
  • Food safety

questions.explanation: While treatment of diseases was original, the specific focus on 'non-communicable diseases' (lifestyle diseases) is an extended/modern element.
questions.hint: Think about modern lifestyle diseases like diabetes and hypertension.

questions.question: Order the logic of PHC implementation from policy to outcome:
questions.explanation: Policy -> System Launch -> Coordination -> Result (Health Improvement).
questions.hint: Start with the government action and end with the result.
